cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northwest across the north-western Caribbean, forecast to cross the northeastern Yucatan early Wednesday and then track north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the Louisiana coast late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely between the lower Mississippi Delta and south-central Louisiana – close to Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet (current watches confined to Yucatan, Cuba, Cayman Islands)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet (current warnings confined to Yucatan, Cuba, Cayman Islands)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from Texas-Louisiana border eastward to Alabama, including the Mississippi Delta
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – guidance suggests widespread 4+ inches possible along the central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes – major hurricane approaching the Mississippi Delta could generate >3-ft surge in and around Plaquemines Parish
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (63%) of tropical-storm-force winds and a moderate chance (33%) of sustained 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible if the center tracks close to the mouth of the Mississippi River.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early NHC messaging indicates potentially dangerous surge for the Louisiana coast later Friday into Saturday; local surge heights could exceed 6 ft in Plaquemines’ exposed areas.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Friday–Saturday could produce 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, leading to flash-flood concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas in approaches, dangerous rip currents, and the threat of isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands once Delta nears the coast.
